comments.html:
I'm more than a little biased, but yes. When you are big, can barely keep up and you are still growing, you get rid of a lot of extra complexity.

Also, at least as AWS, the Software Engineers writing code are also on call. They have a lot of incentive to understand the implications of the features being added. This does not seem to be true for vendors.

Before AWS, Amazon had some really bad multicast failures. The technical leadership across Amazon learned to fear complexity in the network.
comments.name: Justin Pietsch
